headline: The Robot Revolution Is Real. Tesla, Hyundai, and More Stocks to Play It.
summary: Once the domain of science fiction, autonomous robots‚Äîthink C-3PO from Star Wars or Baymax from Big Hero 6‚Äîare getting closer by the year.  At 2025‚Äôs CES electronics conference, there were a handful of humanoids, none of which seemed to catch the world‚Äôs attention.  At January‚Äôs conference, robots, including Boston Dynamics‚Äô Atlas, a 6-foot-2-inch automaton weighing in at just under 200 pounds with a digital smiley face, were the stars.

headline: Stellantis shares plummet on $26.5 billion writedown in EV pullback
summary:
STORY: Stellantis shares plummeted just under a quarter early Friday (February 6).

Investors sold off after it announced $26.5 billion of charges in the second half of last year.

The charges came due to Stellantis scaling back its electric-vehicle ambitions.

The selloff put shares close to their lowest level in almost six years.

And the stock will see its biggest biggest one-day drop on record if the losses hold.

The second-half charges follow similar, albeit smaller, writedowns by rivals including Ford and General Motors.

That's as many Western automakers retreat from battery-powered models in response to the Trump administration's policies and soft demand.

Stellantis CEO Antonio Filosa started downsizing the Fiat and Jeep maker's EV ambitions last year when he took over.

Previous boss Carlos Tavares' strong bet on electrification resulted in a sales decline in Europe.

And in the group's former profit powerhouse, the North American market.

Stellantis will release final second half and full-year 2025 results later this month.

content.title: Stellantis shares plummet on $26.5 billion writedown in EV pullback
content.summary:
STORY: Stellantis shares plummeted just under a quarter early Friday (February 6).

Investors sold off after it announced $26.5 billion of charges in the second half of last year.

The charges came due to Stellantis scaling back its electric-vehicle ambitions.

The selloff put shares close to their lowest level in almost six years.

And the stock will see its biggest biggest one-day drop on record if the losses hold.

The second-half charges follow similar, albeit smaller, writedowns by rivals including Ford and General Motors.

That's as many Western automakers retreat from battery-powered models in response to the Trump administration's policies and soft demand.

Stellantis CEO Antonio Filosa started downsizing the Fiat and Jeep maker's EV ambitions last year when he took over.

Previous boss Carlos Tavares' strong bet on electrification resulted in a sales decline in Europe.

And in the group's former profit powerhouse, the North American market.

Stellantis will release final second half and full-year 2025 results later this month.

headline: How Stellantis's $26 Billion EV Hit Stacks Up Against Some Notorious Writedowns
summary: Stellantis is taking a $26 billion hit due to heavy investment in electric vehicles, not long after Ford took a similar, $19.5 billion charge.  ‚òéÔ∏è Worldcom: The collapsed telecom provider in early 2003 said it would take $79.8 billion of writedowns, months after filing for bankruptcy, as part of a restatement of earlier earnings.  üíø AOL Time Warner: The disastrous media merger prompted a $54 billion charge in the first quarter of 2002 and a $45.5 billion charge in the fourth quarter that year, writing down the value of both of the merged businesses.

content.title: How Stellantis's $26 Billion EV Hit Stacks Up Against Some Notorious Writedowns
content.summary: Stellantis is taking a $26 billion hit due to heavy investment in electric vehicles, not long after Ford took a similar, $19.5 billion charge.  ‚òéÔ∏è Worldcom: The collapsed telecom provider in early 2003 said it would take $79.8 billion of writedowns, months after filing for bankruptcy, as part of a restatement of earlier earnings.  üíø AOL Time Warner: The disastrous media merger prompted a $54 billion charge in the first quarter of 2002 and a $45.5 billion charge in the fourth quarter that year, writing down the value of both of the merged businesses.

headline: Stellantis Stock Drops 28% After Massive EV Write-Down. It Won‚Äôt Pay a Dividend.
summary: A massive write-down and dividend suspension have  Stellantis  stock plummeting on Friday.  The Chrysler parent announced one-time charges of ‚Ç¨22 billion ($25.9 billion), including roughly $20 billion related to electric vehicles, $4.1 billion in warranty-related costs, and other items.  ‚ÄúThe reset we have announced today is part of the decisive process we started in 2025, to once again make our customers and their preferences our guiding star,‚Äù said CEO Antonio Filosa in a news release.

headline: Stellantis takes massive hit on 'overestimation' of EV demand
summary:
Jeep maker Stellantis warned Friday that it would take a 22 billion euro hit after a slower take up of electric vehicles than it expected, heaping pressure on its new chief executive to navigate a chaotic transition from combustion engines.- 'We went bigger'¬†-
Filosa said 75 percent of the financial hit stemmed from being "over-optimistic" on the adoption of electric vehicles, mainly in North America.

content.title: Stellantis takes massive hit on 'overestimation' of EV demand
content.summary:
Jeep maker Stellantis warned Friday that it would take a 22 billion euro hit after a slower take up of electric vehicles than it expected, heaping pressure on its new chief executive to navigate a chaotic transition from combustion engines.- 'We went bigger'¬†-
Filosa said 75 percent of the financial hit stemmed from being "over-optimistic" on the adoption of electric vehicles, mainly in North America.
